DOC.HEAD: Canon To Pay $2.5 Million To Settle Overcharge Allegations
Eds: SUBS penultimate graf to add company no comment
DOC.TEXT: Canon U.S.A. Inc. has agreed to pay $2.5 million to settle allegations that it overcharged the federal government for copiers, the Department of Justice announced Friday. The department contended that Canon submitted incomplete and inadequate price information to the General Services Administration in bidding for contracts to rent and sell copies to federal agencies. As a result, GSA was unable to negotiate prices equal to those offered by Canon to its most favored commercial customers, the department said. The alleged overcharges occurred during fiscal years 1984 and 1985. At Canon's headquarters in Lake Success, N.Y., company spokesman Hajima Hirai declined comment on the department's announcement except to say, ``We are satisfied with the way it is written.'' The settlement was negotiated by the Commercial Litigation Branch of the department's Civil Division.
